communityRules.title: Community Rules – I.Z.I
communityRules.intro: In I.Z.I. your diary is your intimate space. Chat is an addition to connect with other people safely and respectfully.
communityRules.purpose: For it to work, we need everyone to follow some simple rules:

rule1.title: Mutual respect
rule1.content: Talking to someone is an act of trust. Don't use insults, harassment or threats. Empathy is the foundation of this space.

rule2.title: Safe content
rule2.content: No explicit sexual messages, violence, disturbing images or illegal activities. We want a safe place.

rule3.title: Proper use of chat
rule3.content: No spam, advertising, chains or identity impersonation.

rule4.title: Privacy
rule4.content: Don't share your or others' personal data (phones, addresses, social networks). Your safety comes first.

rule5.title: Responsible use
rule5.content: Remember: I.Z.I. does not replace doctors or psychologists. The SOS Button connects to official lines, it's not a medical emergency.

consequences.title: Consequences if you don't comply
consequences.note: Sanctions never affect your diary or your fortune cookies. They only apply to chat.

warning.title: Warning
warning.content: If something doesn't fit, we warn you and the message is deleted.

temporaryBlock.title: Temporary block
temporaryBlock.content: If you repeat, you'll lose chat access for a few hours (12–24h).

sevenDaySuspension.title: 7-day suspension
sevenDaySuspension.content: For more serious cases like repeated harassment or spam.

chatExpulsion.title: Chat expulsion
chatExpulsion.content: For very serious conduct (threats, sexual or violent content, risk of harm). You'll keep your diary, but you won't be able to use chat again.

seriousExceptions.title: Serious exceptions
seriousExceptions.content: In cases of obvious crimes (e.g. child pornography, terrorist threats, serious self-harm) the complete account may be suspended and cooperation with authorities will apply according to law.

reminder.title: Your diary is untouchable.
reminder.content: Chat is an extra gift, use it with respect so it remains a safe space for everyone.

intro.company: OASYS NEST, S.L.U. informs about the use of cookies on its website:

whatAreCookies.title: What are cookies?
whatAreCookies.description: Cookies are files that can be downloaded to your device through web pages. They are tools that play an essential role in providing numerous information society services. Among other things, they allow a website to store and retrieve information about the browsing habits of a user or their device and, depending on the information obtained, can be used to recognize the user and improve the service offered.

typesOfCookies.title: Types of cookies
typesOfCookies.intro: Depending on who manages the domain from which cookies are sent and processes the data obtained, two types can be distinguished:

byEntity.title: According to the managing entity

own.title: First-party cookies
own.description: Those sent to the user's device from a computer or domain managed by the publisher itself and from which the service requested by the user is provided.

thirdParty.title: Third-party cookies
thirdParty.description: Those sent to the user's device from a computer or domain that is not managed by the publisher, but by another entity that processes the data obtained through cookies.

byEntity.note: If cookies are installed from a computer or domain managed by the publisher itself but the information collected through them is managed by a third party, they cannot be considered first-party cookies.

byDuration.title: According to the time they remain stored

session.title: Session cookies
session.description: Designed to collect and store data while the user accesses a web page. They are usually used to store information that is only relevant for the provision of the service requested by the user on a single occasion (e.g., a list of purchased products).

persistent.title: Persistent cookies
persistent.description: Data remains stored on the device and can be accessed and processed for a period defined by the cookie owner, which can range from a few minutes to several years.

byPurpose.title: According to the purpose of data processing

technical.title: Technical cookies
technical.description: Those that allow users to navigate through a website, platform, or application and use the different options or services available, such as controlling traffic and data communication, identifying the session, accessing restricted areas, remembering items in an order, completing a purchase process, applying for registration or participation in an event, using security features during navigation, storing content for video or sound broadcasting, or sharing content through social networks.

personalization.title: Personalization cookies
personalization.description: Allow users to access the service with predefined general characteristics based on criteria on the user's device, such as language, browser type, regional settings from which they access the service, etc.

analytics.title: Analytics cookies
analytics.description: Allow the responsible party to track and analyze the behavior of users on linked websites. Information collected through these cookies is used to measure website, application, or platform activity and to create browsing profiles of users, with the aim of introducing improvements based on data usage analysis.

advertising.title: Advertising cookies
advertising.description: Enable the most efficient management of advertising spaces.

behavioral.title: Behavioral advertising cookies
behavioral.description: Store information about user behavior obtained through continuous observation of their browsing habits, allowing the development of a specific profile to show advertising based on it.

socialMedia.title: External social media cookies
socialMedia.description: Used to allow visitors to interact with content from different social platforms (Facebook, YouTube, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.) and are generated only for users of those social networks. The terms of use of these cookies and the information collected are governed by the privacy policy of the corresponding social platform.

disableCookies.title: Disabling and deleting cookies
disableCookies.intro: You have the option to allow, block, or delete cookies installed on your device by configuring the browser options installed on your computer. By disabling cookies, some of the available services may no longer be operational. The way to disable cookies is different for each browser, but can usually be done from the Tools or Options menu. You can also consult the browser's Help menu where you can find instructions. Users can choose at any time which cookies they want to function on this website.

meta.description: Frequently asked questions about I.Z.I Premium subscriptions, payments, and features. Learn how to subscribe, cancel, request refunds, and more.

Faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
Faqs.subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about I.Z.I Premium and its features.

items.question: How can I subscribe to I.Z.I. Premium?
items.answer:
You can subscribe to I.Z.I. Premium through three payment methods:

• Apple App Store: For iOS users, the subscription is managed directly from the App Store.
• Google Play: For Android users, you can subscribe through Google Play Billing.
• Web (Stripe): You can subscribe from our official website using credit/debit cards or compatible wallets.

items.question: How do I cancel my subscription?
items.answer:
Canceling your subscription depends on where you made the purchase:

• App Store: Go to Settings > [your name] > Subscriptions, select I.Z.I. Premium and cancel.
• Google Play: Open Google Play Store > Menu > Subscriptions > I.Z.I. Premium > Cancel subscription.
• Web (Stripe): Access the Stripe customer portal from your account or contact support to manage your subscription.

items.question: How do I request a refund?
items.answer:
The refund process varies depending on the purchase platform:

• Apple purchases: Visit reportaproblem.apple.com to request a refund.
• Google purchases: Go to play.google.com/store/account and request a refund from your purchase history.
• Web purchases (Stripe): Refunds are only processed in legally required cases. Contact support at dpo@iziworld.app

items.question: Can I change or upgrade my subscription plan?
items.answer:
Yes, you can change or upgrade your subscription at any time. The change will apply at your next renewal:

• From App Store or Google Play: Go to the subscriptions section in your app store and select the new plan.
• From Stripe (web): Access the customer portal to update your plan. Changes will take effect in the next billing cycle.

items.question: Do prices include taxes?
items.answer:
Tax inclusion in the price varies by location:

• Europe, Latin America, Australia, and Canada: Displayed prices include all applicable taxes.
• United States: Sales tax is added at checkout according to your state's laws.

items.question: Will I receive an invoice or payment receipt?
items.answer:
Yes, you will receive a payment receipt depending on the platform used:

• Apple and Google: Invoices are available in your App Store or Google Play account, in the purchase history.
• Stripe (web): You will receive a receipt via email automatically after each payment. You can also access your receipts in the Stripe customer portal.

items.question: What happens if a payment fails or my card expires?
items.answer:
If a payment fails or your card expires, we will notify you and give you time to update your payment information:

• Stripe (web): Automatically retries the charge and sends you an email notification. You can update your payment method in the customer portal.
• Apple and Google: You will receive notifications on your respective platforms requesting that you update your payment information.

Your premium access will remain active during a grace period while you update your information.

items.question: What payment methods do you accept?
items.answer:
We accept multiple payment methods for your convenience:

• In the App (iOS): Apple Pay and payment methods configured in your Apple account.
• In the App (Android): Google Play Billing (cards, PayPal, etc.).
• On the Web: Credit and debit cards (Visa, Mastercard, American Express) and compatible digital wallets through Stripe.
